body:
I avoided the apostrophe because it makes the post weird and I dont (See? No apostrophe) want to find out escape characters.  Over here on Ruqqus, we have had enough of media censorship to protect China, radical SJWs, and their own ass.

I used to like the cool stuff Reddit had, but this has gone too far; memories of old times and fun discussions and posts kept telling us: "It will get better, I promise!  Just think of those good times you had here.  Dont you want to keep your account, maybe just in case?".  No, I dont want to keep scrolling through low effort karma farms.  I dont want to spend my time making a post and have it be taken down because "Yall cant behave", "keep it civil", or some other vague, selectively enforced BS.

I hate to say it, but the truth of the matter is that Reddit ALREADY DIED.  It is just a name now to justify what mods and Reddit itself does.  Do not fear, however, because, like I said, people (some) keep their account because of the good times that wont be on Reddit anymore.

Ruqqus is exactly what Reddit was supposed to be in the beginning.  Ruqqus is hope.  Ruqqus is where community based media is at its peak potential.  If you were searching for that feeling of freedom and maybe even dumb fun, well shit, here it is folks.

Anyway, I will delete my Reddit account to show my severed ties with that pile of rubble on the first of July.  If you want to show Reddit that censorship will not be tolerated, comment down below that you will delete your account with your karma, stats, etc.  and be sure to do it ON THE DATE!  If I dont delete after that date, downvote me to hell 
(I won`t delete my Ruqqus account, BTW).

A_VERY_Good_Sir will be gone along with its 1 follower and 1.1k karma on 7/1/2020 and I hope you too on +WatchRedditDie because I will probably post a screen recording on some shit I download off the Microsoft Store.

title: REDDIT ACCOUNT DELETION PACT      {7/1/2020}

body:
The joke is on you. I closed my account months ago. I only kept using reddit for the content, because replying seemed to be upvoted only if it started with "that's really great; fantastic; true genius; but perhaps ...", and discussion is nearly impossible.

It's also as horribly addictive as any other "social" medium. It's cancer.
body_html:
The joke is on you. I closed my account months ago. I only kept using reddit for the content, because replying seemed to be upvoted only if it started with "that's really great; fantastic; true genius; but perhaps ...", and discussion is nearly impossible.

body: Haven’t had a reddit account since 2016. You could see the direction it was heading already back then.
